message_tags.name: Panhellenic at The University of Miami

data.message: I highly recommend it! I wasn't really into the sorority thing at all, and I kinda signed up for recruitment on a whim... but it really ended up being one of the best decisions I've ever made. It's never too late to join either! I have sisters who joined as juniors and have never regretted it. You can go through informal recruitment in the fall, which includes a few sororities, or you can go through formal recruitment next spring (January 2015, since this year's sign up is closed) which would allow you to see all the sororities. Registration for Spring 2015 recruitment begins next fall and there will be a link to sign up on the Panhellenic at The University of Miami page! If you have any more questions, please message me, this year's recruitment chair Riddhi, or the new incoming Panhellenic Recruitment Chair Kiki :)

I joined as a senior, but honestly if you are interested go for it freshmen year. That way you can maximize your time with it and also if you're interested go through recruitment :) since you're not doing it in this spring, look into the spring of your sophomore. Oh and some do informal recruitment too

registration for spring rush this year has already passed, so unfortunately now you'll have to wait until next spring, but definitely stay involved with greek life and look into rushing next year! it's a great opportunity and extremely rewarding. next fall girls will start posting links to the registration page, so just keep an eye out! :)
Some sororities do COB in the spring so keep an eye out in case!

I get so frustrated with people saying that the football players are nothing without football. The ones I have met are really nice guys, and they don't deserve to be treated like they are worthless. Don't let a few bad eggs spoil things for the rest, and let's all just get along :)

They're just like everyone else except they can play an instrument and memorize music faster than you can memorize your notes for Spanish class.

We have the number 3 recruiting class in the nation so we are only going up from here. I feel that there are very few students here that are loyal fans of our athletics. I'm one of them. #canegangordie

I was an athlete for 10 years (Track), and although an injury has prevented me from starting as a student athlete again I can definitely say that many athletes put in countless hours of work to perfect what they love to do. As you saw not everything goes perfectly, but they have the same dreams and aspirations as you. There is like 1 engineer on the team, a lot of exercise physiology majors (not easy), and a lot of sports admin, etc... The athletics department probably brings in a couple million (iidk the exact number because were private), and they see little of it. We got a much needed renovation of the athletic center, but besides that everything else goes to building the SAC and initiatives like Momentum 1 and 2. I attend the practices as an athletic training student, and the dedication the athletic trainers and coaches have to the athletes is unfounded, the dedication the players have to "the game" can only grow.
But that's fine. Try not having a marching band and see how exciting your games are when there's no one there to play your fight songs or your Alma Mater.

I don't think anyone is bowing down to the football players but needless to say, without the football team we wouldn't be The U. We'd just be the University of Miami (FL). Watch the 30 for 30 The U documentary. It explains a lot.

message_tags.name: UMiami Alpha Phi Omega - Alpha Pi Chapter

data.message: UMiami Alpha Phi Omega - Alpha Pi Chapter is a co-ed service fraternity here at UM. We're having rush in January! If you're interested at all message me and I can get you details for rush events!
Video Games Club is always looking for new members! :)

SpectrUM is a great way to learn about people different from you! Even if you're not up to coming to meetings (which are insanely fun/engaging), we have plenty of activities planned next semester and would love to have you drop by. :)
If you like art and volunteering there's U-Doodle University of Miami.
Students Helping Animals!

If you want a volunteer organization, Project Sunshine takes students to volunteer in the pediatric unit of Holtz Children's Hospital. We play games, do arts and crafts, plan events, and spend time with the kids there and fundraise for them too. :) The kids are really sweet.
Salsacraze!
^The two best clubs on campus for professional development, hands down
Join the scuba club, we're surrounded some beautiful sites!
Play Rugby!!!
Earth Alert and Green Team!
Come join Miami Ballroom!
Why don't you make your own club?
Rush the (coed) National Honor Fraternity Phi Sigma Pi! Look for us at the beginning of next semester at the breezeway

message_tags.name: UM ACS! Association of Commuter Students
UMiami Alpha Phi Omega - Alpha Pi Chapter

data.message: UM ACS! Association of Commuter Students and greek life and UMiami Alpha Phi Omega - Alpha Pi Chapter

TAMID offers students the chance to earn community service hours while consulting for startups. Some of our members have acquired full time positions with companies we've worked with previously. We also teach members how to invest and how to begin their own startup. We work closely with the Entrepreneurship Society, led by Bernie Turi. Message me if you'd like to learn more. I'm currently serving as president.
Join UM Habitat for Humanity  and  UM UGenerations

#1896: To all the people saying that other people should talk to you when you're in class/the elevator/laundry room/random places on campus, why don't you talk to other people first? (here's the secret part) Some of us are too shy to say anything (even if it is small talk) despite the fact that we want to make new friends and wish we had the ability to not care what others think about us. I'm one of those people who don't enjoy meeting my peers because I'm too afraid of being judged by those around me, so I tend to just hover in the background and wait and hope for someone to talk to me first. It takes me a while to open up to new people and it actually makes me feel extremely comfortable to make small talk with my peers (to me, it feels fake and forced and if I try and people seem to react poorly, it only makes me feel more uncomfortable about approaching random/new people). You wouldn't know this about me either if you saw me interact with my current friends, so please don't think that if someone you sort of make eye contact with or are in close proximity with is being rude if they don't say anything to you. They literally might be just like me and are too irrationally anxious to make small talk in fear that they will be judged for something they most likely won't be judged for.
Megan McCrink

I was in an LDR and it was for a long time. I thought about whether or not this would happen to me. Personally, if my boyfriend did what you did, I'd want him to tell me immediately. I'd be more inclined to believe his story and "let it go". I also would do everything you could to get this girl you kind-of sort-of cheated with out of your life. Delete her cellphone number, unfriend her on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram...everything. Show your girlfriend that she matters more than anyone else. And finally, when you do talk to your girlfriend, before you do the "baby I'm so sorry please take me back" speech...stop. Don't be whiny and act like you "didn't know what you were doing". Be firm and keep it real. I can't guarantee she won't dump you, but if you make an active effort to keep her informed and not act like you were "Mr. Innocent", you might stand a chance. Best of luck dude.
get a real hand job next time.

This is more for the future, but if you know a friend is into you it is a good idea to not have them in your life. It's not really fair to your significant other because trust issues are bound to occur. It sucks to let go of a friend like that, but if you really care about your significant other it is better in the long run :) also if your friend really respected you and your relationship they would suppress their feelings to preserve your friendship.
Take full responsibility for your actions and know that you are a cheater.

#1891: @ 1763: This is in response to the girl who wrote about women’s virginity. It seemed like no one really understood what you were trying to say and I agree with you so much I’m going to try to enlighten some people that commented some rude things but added no argument whatsoever. 

Most virgins that I’ve spoken to aren’t virgins because they haven’t had the chance to have sex. They are virgins because some sort of inbred line of thinking tells them that having sex just because is wrong. Not all girls are waiting to get married, some are just waiting for the right guy. That’s totally okay. It’s fine to be a virgin. Everyone should have sex when they feel that they are ready. That wasn’t the point, nor the problem. 

The problem is the CONCEPT of virginity, the value our society places on girls staying virgins. Many of these virgins, strongly believe that having sex will make them less pure. They think that it’s wrong, that they will loose something if they have sex. They feel special because they’ve waited. They think they will be of less value if they have sex for the first time. Sometimes they are condescending towards other women that actively have sex. These women aren’t necessarily whores, they’re adults who are comfortable with their sex lives and take care of their bodies. They want to have sex so they do. And that’s it. If you’re a virgin, it should be because you aren’t ready to have sex. You shouldn’t remain a virgin because you are safeguarding your hymen. You shouldn’t be a virgin because society and religion is sexist. 

‘I’m a virgin.’ If you use it as a sort of  ‘status’ then you are a virgin for the wrong reasons. You shouldn’t be praised for being a virgin. There’s nothing wrong with it, nor nothing commendable about it either. It just means that you haven’t had sex yet, and that’s okay. But don’t judge other women for having sex, that’s not okay.

As a EE+physics major graduating in May, if you ever want to be seen as something other than an arrogant twat, give up the engineering circlejerk. Yes, it's hard, I get that. But it doesn't mean you should think yourself better than others.

If you're not serious about your major, of course it's going to be "easy." Have you taken the time to network with others in the business field, apply for internships, try to create a company, market yourself or ideas, go above and beyond what is required? That's what a serious business major does. If you think you're more intelligent or you have life harder just because you're a STEM major, pre-med, etc, you're an idiot.

#1872: I was in marching band in high school. One time, at band camp, someone left their trumpet mouthpiece unguarded when he went to the bathroom during a break. Everyone took advantage, and naturally, took turns rubbing the mouthpiece on their buttholes. When everyone got back from the break, everyone waited with bated breath for the first taste he got. However, before we started, the band director needed to show the trumpets how to play a certain part, and needed to borrow a trumpet. You can guess who's he borrowed. The weirdest part: he didn't notice either the smell or taste of it, and proceeded to wipe the mouthpiece after he was done with it. Nobody ever told him the truth.

#1858: So, so, so many special snowflakes posting on the page. If you're a decent human being you don't deserve an award. Obviously this is directed to the tons of people posting about how they're nice and "different than the other guys/girls" and can't find relationships and all that nonsense. If you go into a relationship thinking that you're doing the other person a favor by being nice, that's going to be a toxic relationship. I hope you guys stay single and work out that mentality, because man, that's going to bite you in the ass later. Also, holy crap you don't need a relationship to function and be happy as a human being. Become comfortable with who you are first before you start worrying and caring about someone else. Because if you don't, I guarantee the relationship will fall apart within a month and then you're back at square one. 

So moral of the story: Don't be a dick, don't be a special snowflake, BE AN HUMAN BEING WITH AN INTERESTING PERSONALITY, GOALS, DREAMS, AND PASSIONS.

#1856: I thought I would make so many real friends here, but the friends I thought I had made first semester were't really there for me.  Now i'm finding who my true friends are, and it's a good thing to know who really cares about me.  But, because I "settled" with those girls and depended on them, I am coming up short in friend,s and now I am having a hard time making new ones.  I found a sweet sweet girl who I connect very very well with but she lives off campus, and I barely see her.  People make mistakes, we all do, and I am trying to learn from any social mistakes I know I have made, and never repeat them.  I try to exert kindness, and avoid conflict, forgive, and let go.  My biggest insecurity is whether people like me or not, whether they think of me positively. I just look forward to moving out of Stanford, joining greek life, and finally finally finally meeting more people like me and who will appreciate me as a person. :')

Beginning with 1985's Florida Clean Indoor Air Act. In 2002, 71 percent of Florida citizens voted for a constitutional amendment to prohibit smoking in most indoor workplaces. This smoke-free law became effective in 2003. As a result, it is now illegal to smoke indoors as well as in nearly all workplace areas and spaces open to the public in Florida.
The Act includes educational facilities in its smoking ban. In addition, the act makes it illegal for anyone to smoke within 1,000 feet of any public or private grade school between the hours of 6:00 AM and midnight.
Rob, way to confirm you're the worst kind of person.
Many people (myself included) are allergic to cigarette smoke (I get incredibly nauseous). I'm all for personal freedoms but PLEASE just try smoke in less crowded areas.
i enjoyed the sentiment "there's nothing you can do about it." all i can say is we'll see ;)

Anyone who smokes in a designated non-smoking area commits a non-criminal violation. The first violation is punishable by no more than $100 while subsequent violations are punishable by no more than $500.

Florida residents have the right to report violations of the FCIAA to the DOH and other appropriate state agencies. Upon notification of observed violations, the DOH or other enforcement authority will issue the requisite fine to the violator as well as a notice to comply to the person in charge of the place in which the violation occurred. If that person fails to comply within 30 days, the authority will fine him too, with a civil penalty between $250 and $750 for the first violation and up to $2000 for any subsequent violation.
